headline.main: 4 Brain Chemicals in Babies May Foretell Autism and Retardation

docs.lead_paragraph: Scientists have discovered what they believe may be biological markers in the blood of newborn infants who later develop autism and mental retardation. The markers consist of abnormally high levels of four brain chemicals that help construct the basic architecture of animal brains, researchers said. The finding supports what many experts believe may be the root cause of both autism and mental retardation: faulty wiring present from birth.

headline.main: A Case for Expanding the Doctor's Checklist

docs.abstract: Jane E Brody Personal Health column relates her recent first visit to an internist, and how impressed she was with medical history form that she was asked to fill out that was unusually thorough in exploring factors that could affect her health or influence any symptoms she might have; notes, however, that she was dismayed by seeming lack of concern about eating, exercise and stress reduction (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: What should your doctor know about you even before you have donned that unglamorous gown and related the reason for your visit? On a recent first visit to an internist, I was handed a medical history form that struck me as unusually thorough in exploring factors that could affect my health or influence any symptoms I might have. The form reflected some of the most pressing medical-social issues of our day. In addition to the usual questions about my personal and family medical history, current symptoms or complaints about my health, allergies, operations, immunizations and personal habits like smoking and drinking, I was asked:
